newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine banks open for business despite strike.
newsitem.headline: Argentine banks open for business despite strike.

text.p: Banks in Argentina's capital were functioning normally Friday in spite of a 36-hour general strike by trade unions protesting the government's economic policy.
Even though banks kept their doors open, some said they expected few customers because of the stoppage in public transport caused by the walkout.
Bus, train and underground services were limited, meaning less people were able to travel to their banks.
Argentina's Banking Association said the turnout of people at work in private and state financial institutions was high.
Financial markets were hampered by lower volumes and some traders took the day off. But there was sufficient trade to prevent markets from standing still.

As on Thursday when the strike started at noon, traders predicted activity would likely diminish during the day. On Thursday, both bond and stock market traders reported much higher volumes than they had anticipated considering the strike.
